Column Comment.0: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.1: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: ABSTRACT NUMBER: Number assigned by the Texas General Land Office to theblocks and surveys in a county. Each number is unique within a given county.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.6: AREA TYPE: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, county, district,province, state, city, geographic, geologic etc.
Column Comment.7: BLOCK FRACTION: Number identifying the fractional portion of a block (e.g., .5).
Column Comment.8: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: EAST WEST DIRECTION: Indicates whether measurements are made East or Westof the EW START LINE. The EW direction may be stored explicitly or it may becalculated. The directions indicated in EW direction and NS direction must allow thefootage measurements to indicate a point of convergence (they have to identify aspecific point on the earth). If the directions do not allow the footage measurementsto converge, one of the directions is most likely incorrect.
Column Comment.11: EAST WEST FOOTAGE: Distance measured in feet, from a east or west referenceline to the well location (e.g., 660FEL).
Column Comment.12: EAST WEST FOOTAGE OUOM: East/West footage original unit of measure.
Column Comment.13: EAST-WEST START LINE: The east-west starting lines for offset distances. Thesedescriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such as Texassurveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FEL (first east line),NEL (northmost east line),...
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.15: FOOTAGE ORIGIN: The point of origin used in measuring the survey footage calls toa well location.
Column Comment.16: LABOR: Alphanumeric code identifying the labor sub-division of a league (SpanishLand Grant).
Column Comment.17: LEAGUE: Alphanumeric code identifying the league sub-division of a survey(Spanish Land Grant).
Column Comment.18: NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid north-southDirections. For example, North, South.
Column Comment.19: NORTH SOUTH FOOTAGE: Distance measured in feet, from a north or southreference line to the well location (e.g., 660FNL).
Column Comment.20: NORTH SOUTH FOOTAGE OUOM: North/South footage original unit of measure.
Column Comment.21: NORTH-SOUTH START LINE: The north-south starting lines for offset distances.These descriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such asTexas surveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FSL (first southline), ESL (eastmost south line), ...
Column Comment.22: PORCION NUMBER: Refers to the very large original Spanish landgrants foundprimarily in south Texas along the Rio Grande. Porcions may be assigned areference number and a survey name.
Column Comment.23: PORCION SURVEY NAME: The survey name assigned to the porcion by the texassurvey system.
Column Comment.24: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: SCALED FOOTAGE INDICATOR: A yes / no flag indicating that the operator filedpermit/plat well location footage is different from the clients interpreted mappedfootage. In this case, the clients well location footage is indicated as scaled footage.
Column Comment.27: SECTION FRACTION: Number indicating the fractional portion of a section (e.g., .5).
Column Comment.28: SPOT CODE: Code identifying a quartered division of a section, also known as thealiquot description (e.g., NW SE NE, C SW, etc.).
Column Comment.29: TEXAS BLOCK: A county sub-divided by the Texas General Land Office into blocksand surveys.
Column Comment.30: TEXAS LOT: Number identifying the sub-division of a section or farm tract.
Column Comment.31: TEXAS SECTION: Number identifying the section within a given township.
Column Comment.32: SHARE: Shares are further breakdowns of porcions, similar to leagues and labors.
Column Comment.33: TEXAS SUBDIVISION: One of the divisions of land in Texas
Column Comment.34: TEXAS SURVEY: Name identifying the Texas survey within a given county.
Column Comment.35: TEXAS TOWNSHIP: Number identifying the township sub-division of a Texas survey.
Column Comment.36: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.37: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)
Column Comment.38: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.39: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.40: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.41: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.42: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.43: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.44: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
